page.title: 15A Day at St.Donats
page.content: On a sunny Tuesday in late June Classes 1 & 2 from St Illtyds Junior School were to spend a day at St Donats Castle.We were greeted by a student from the Falkland Islands who was to be our guide.We were first shown the farmland beloning to the castle and then we walked past the students quarters on our way to the swimming pool.There the students were doing a course on canoeing.Opposite the pool was a lifeboat owned and designed by the students named the AMERICAN AMBASSADOR.We were then shown the launching pad of the boat.Next we saw the students abseiling down the cliff face.Every student has to go through this training.After this we wandered through the beautiful rose gardens and saw also the places of historical interest at the castle.We had a very enjoyable day.
